7.html:
A barkeep, also known as a bartender or barmaid (depending on gender), is a person who prepares and serves alcoholic (and sometimes non-alcoholic) beverages behind a bar in a pub, tavern, restaurant, or other drinking establishment. The role of a barkeep includes a variety of tasks and responsibilities:

  1. Mixing Drinks: Barkeepers are skilled in mixing cocktails and other beverages according to recipes or customer preferences.
  2. Serving Customers: They serve drinks to customers, ensuring that everyone is attended to in a timely manner.
  3. Customer Service: Barkeepers often engage with customers, providing friendly and efficient service, and sometimes offering a listening ear or conversation.
  4. Maintaining the Bar Area: They keep the bar area clean and well-stocked, including washing glasses, restocking bottles, and organizing supplies.
  5. Handling Payments: Barkeepers manage transactions, including taking payments, giving change, and keeping track of tabs.
  6. Checking IDs: Ensuring that customers are of legal drinking age is an important part of their responsibilities.
  7. Monitoring Consumption: They also need to be aware of customers' alcohol consumption and may refuse service to those who are visibly intoxicated or disruptive.
  8. Knowledge of Beverages: Barkeepers typically have extensive knowledge of different types of alcoholic beverages, including beers, wines, and spirits, as well as the ability to make recommendations to customers.

In addition to these tasks, an experienced barkeep may also handle inventory management, create new drink recipes, and contribute to the overall atmosphere and success of the establishment.
7.text:
A barkeep, also known as a bartender or barmaid (depending on gender), is a person who prepares and serves alcoholic (and sometimes non-alcoholic) beverages behind a bar in a pub, tavern, restaurant, or other drinking establishment. The role of a barkeep includes a variety of tasks and responsibilities:

Mixing Drinks: Barkeepers are skilled in mixing cocktails and other beverages according to recipes or customer preferences.
Serving Customers: They serve drinks to customers, ensuring that everyone is attended to in a timely manner.
Customer Service: Barkeepers often engage with customers, providing friendly and efficient service, and sometimes offering a listening ear or conversation.
Maintaining the Bar Area: They keep the bar area clean and well-stocked, including washing glasses, restocking bottles, and organizing supplies.
Handling Payments: Barkeepers manage transactions, including taking payments, giving change, and keeping track of tabs.
Checking IDs: Ensuring that customers are of legal drinking age is an important part of their responsibilities.
Monitoring Consumption: They also need to be aware of customers' alcohol consumption and may refuse service to those who are visibly intoxicated or disruptive.
Knowledge of Beverages: Barkeepers typically have extensive knowledge of different types of alcoholic beverages, including beers, wines, and spirits, as well as the ability to make recommendations to customers.

In addition to these tasks, an experienced barkeep may also handle inventory management, create new drink recipes, and contribute to the overall atmosphere and success of the establishment.
7.title: What is a pubkeeper?

15.html: At the moment the only social channels we engage in are on Twitter. We do not have a strategy other than letting the world know we are still alive.

15.title: Track Social Media Engagement

16.html: This role is managed by the XComs hat currently worn by earth2travis.eth

16.title: Roles

17.html: We have a DAOhaus Social Tracking Google sheet for tracking engagement and measuring our performance.
17.text: We have a DAOhaus Social Tracking Google sheet for tracking engagement and measuring our performance.
17.title: Tools

18.html:
At the beginning of each month we need to update the spreadsheet with the data from the previous month.

  1. Open the DAOhaus Social Tracking Google sheet
  2. Add a new heading for the previous month
  3. Scroll down to the beginning of the previous month in the DAOhaus profile
  4. command+click each tweet to open it in a new tab
  5. Add the Type, Tweet, URL, Comments, Retweets, Likes, Bookmarks, and Views
  6. Repeat for each tweet that month
  7. Count the total number of T, RT, QT and add that below the months heading
  8. Add a formula to calculate the sum for each column
  9. Paste the data for that month into and the calculation script below into Chat GPT to identify the best performing tweet for that month
  10. Make the best performing tweet bold
  11. Ask Chat GPT to convert the table to Markdown and show you the code
  12. Paste the code into that month's GitHub issue related to Reporting Social Media Engagement under a Data heading (Example)
  13. Add bullets for the total amount of Tweets, Retweets, and Quote tweets
  14. Embed the best performing tweet
  15. Share the data and best performing Tweet in the 💥-news-flash channel on Discord
  16. Create Issue for the next month
  17. Add reminder to calender to track next month's social media engagement
  18. Add social tag to GitHub issue
  19. Close the GitHub issue
  20. Create GitHub issue for payment

Add reminder to calender to track next month's social media engagement

Close the GitHub issue
Create GitHub issue for payment
18.title: Procedure

19.html:
# Create a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
 
# Define a performance metric
df["Performance"] = df["Comments"] + df["Retweets"] + df["Likes"] + df["Bookmarks"] + df["Views"]
 
# Find the tweet with the highest performance
best_performance_tweet = df.loc[df["Performance"].idxmax()]
 
best_performance_tweet
19.text:
# Create a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
 
# Define a performance metric
df["Performance"] = df["Comments"] + df["Retweets"] + df["Likes"] + df["Bookmarks"] + df["Views"]
 
# Find the tweet with the highest performance
best_performance_tweet = df.loc[df["Performance"].idxmax()]
 
best_performance_tweet
19.title: Calculations

20.html:
Payments for PublicHaus maintenance are made using Superfluid on OP Mainnet.

Protocolooors and Platformoooors each receive 0.75 ETHx per month for their chores around the $HAUS. These funds are used at the discretion of the wearer of the Hat associated with that role. Funds are used for paying for various tasks and bounties required for keeping the $HAUS in order.
20.text:
Payments for PublicHaus maintenance are made using Superfluid on OP Mainnet.
Protocolooors and Platformoooors each receive 0.75 ETHx per month for their chores around the $HAUS. These funds are used at the discretion of the wearer of the Hat associated with that role. Funds are used for paying for various tasks and bounties required for keeping the $HAUS in order.
20.title: Make Payments From Superfluid

22.html:
Superfluid uses a combination of Super ETH (ETHx) and Constant Inflow NFTs (CIF) to make their magic.

  • Protocolooors
  • Platformoooors
22.text:
Superfluid uses a combination of Super ETH (ETHx) and Constant Inflow NFTs (CIF) to make their magic.

Protocolooors
Platformoooors
22.title: Streams

24.html:
1. Open Gnosis Safe of stream Receiver
  • Protocolooors
  • Platformoooors
  1. Goto Apps > Superfluid
  2. Navigate to Wrap/Unwrap
  3. Click Unwrap tab
  4. Enter amount of ETHx to unwrap
  5. Click Unwrap button
  6. Confirm Transaction
  7. Execute Transaction
  8. Finish

Once the is uwrapped you should see the Ether in the balance under the Assets item in the Gnosis Safe wallet.
24.text:
Open Gnosis Safe of stream Receiver


Protocolooors
Platformoooors


Goto Apps > Superfluid
Navigate to Wrap/Unwrap
Click Unwrap tab
Enter amount of ETHx to unwrap
Click Unwrap button
Confirm Transaction
Execute Transaction
Finish

Once the is uwrapped you should see the Ether in the balance under the Assets item in the Gnosis Safe wallet.
24.title: Unwrap ETHx

25.html:
1. Goto Assets item in Gnosis Safe
  2. Hover over Ether
  3. Click the Send button
  4. Enter Recipient address on OP Mainnet
  5. Enter Amount
  6. Click Next
  7. Sign
  8. Execute
  9. Finish

Verify funds were received in your EOA or notify the recipient. Share message on Discord to inform the DAO a payment was made.

Verify funds were received in your EOA or notify the recipient. Share message on Discord to inform the DAO a payment was made.

26.html:
Facilitating Demo Day demands a bold and spirited approach to guarantee an event that celebrates our community's graft and achievements. The facilitator, acting as the Master of Ceremonies (MC), is responsible for keeping the crowd engaged, maintaining a lively atmosphere, and ensuring the event stays on schedule. Here's what's needed:

  • Start Event on Discord
  • Welcome attendees
  • Set the stage with an introduction to the season's Objectives
  • Spill what you’re hyped about
  • Introduce each project
  • Stir up questions and keep the dialogue gritty
  • Wrap it up with a bang
  • Tease brilliance of the coming season
26.text:
Facilitating Demo Day demands a bold and spirited approach to guarantee an event that celebrates our community's graft and achievements. The facilitator, acting as the Master of Ceremonies (MC), is responsible for keeping the crowd engaged, maintaining a lively atmosphere, and ensuring the event stays on schedule. Here's what's needed:

Start Event on Discord
Welcome attendees
Set the stage with an introduction to the season's Objectives
Spill what you’re hyped about
Introduce each project
Stir up questions and keep the dialogue gritty
Wrap it up with a bang
Tease brilliance of the coming season
26.title: Facilitate Demo Day

27.html:
As the MC, you’re the heartbeat of the event, like a rogue in a rowdy tavern. Your role is to ensure that:

  • We hit our marks so every project gets its spotlight.
  • The atmosphere is celebratory.
  • Participants feel valued and fired up.

By following these steps, we can ensure a Demo Day that’s as unforgettable as the community that built it. Let’s show ‘em what we’re made of and revel in our shared chaos and creativity.

28.title: Publish Demo Day

31.html:
• Install/update OBS Studio
  • Set up scene
    • Add Discord application (this is finnicky and may need to be re-selected between sessions) and fit to recording area (trim as needed for privacy)
    • Add "Audio Output Capture"
    • If you add local microphone (not needed) mute it as the use of multiple devices will have your voice coming through the output capture
  • Ensure enough disk space for length of recording (~1GB/hr)
  • Adjust volume levels and test the scene
  • If this is your first time, run a short test record to verify setup
31.text:
Install/update OBS Studio
Set up scene

Add Discord application (this is finnicky and may need to be re-selected between sessions) and fit to recording area (trim as needed for privacy)
Add "Audio Output Capture"
If you add local microphone (not needed) mute it as the use of multiple devices will have your voice coming through the output capture


Ensure enough disk space for length of recording (~1GB/hr)
Adjust volume levels and test the scene
If this is your first time, run a short test record to verify setup
31.title: OBS

32.html:
• Create alt account (or use existing)
    • Log in with this account on recording machine, stay on mute
    • Join server you plan to record, ensure channel access
    • Log in with normal account on another device
    • This is done so that recorder can talk without fiddling with OBS (and still be recorded)
32.text:
Create alt account (or use existing)

Log in with this account on recording machine, stay on mute
Join server you plan to record, ensure channel access
Log in with normal account on another device
This is done so that recorder can talk without fiddling with OBS (and still be recorded)
32.title: Discord

33.html:
• Optionally switch to streamer mode on Discord (this might be automatic)
  • Ask host to let you know when to start and stop recording
    • Start when host says so
    • Stop when finished

35.html: We have a quarterly Demo Day for DAOhaus. This event is to share the work completed in the season. The work should be related to the season's objectives but anything community members shipped and want to share is fair game. It is a time catch up and celebrate our accomplishments.
35.text: We have a quarterly Demo Day for DAOhaus. This event is to share the work completed in the season. The work should be related to the season's objectives but anything community members shipped and want to share is fair game. It is a time catch up and celebrate our accomplishments.
35.title: Schedule Demo Day

36.html:
Schedule Demo Day during the last Community Camp meeting of the current season. Create a Discord event and forum discussion.

  • Channel: open-haus
  • Event Topic: Season # Demo Day
  • Start Date: Last Tuesday of season
  • Start Time: 15:00 CDT
Description:

Join us for Season # Demo Day, a ritual gathering where our community comes together to showcase and celebrate the work we have accomplished this season. Whether it aligns with our seasonal objectives or it's a passion project that shipped, it's all fair game. This is our time to catch up, support each other, and revel in our collective spirit. Let's make some noise and show what DAOhaus is all about!

Cover Image:

38.html:
Create a forum post for community members to share links to their projects and discuss the work completed. Community members should share what they are proud of as well as what was difficult and what failed. This is an opportunity to support and learn from each other. A way to share insights to inspire future collaboration and avoid common pitfalls

  • Channel: 📜-public-forum

New Post

Title: Shipped in Season #

Message:

As we gear up for Season # Demo Day, we want to hear from you! Share links to your projects and let's discuss the the work we shipped. Tell us what you're proud of, what challenges you faced, and what didn't go as planned. This is a chance to support and learn from each other, gain insights to inspire future collaborations, and help us avoid common pitfalls.

Tags: Retro

43.html:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the Demo Day video has been published we can add the choices for retro rewards.

Additional choices can be added by the community but adding the projects from Demo Day encourages participation and shows appreciation.

  • Goto Signals
  • Click the session
43.text:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the Demo Day video has been published we can add the choices for retro rewards.
Additional choices can be added by the community but adding the projects from Demo Day encourages participation and shows appreciation.

Goto Signals
Click the session
43.title: Add Retro Rewards Choices

44.html:
For each project presented in Demo Day:

  1. Click Add Choice
  2. Fill out the form

  • Choice Title: Name of project
  • Choice Description (markdown): Brief description of project
  • Link: Link to site or app
  • YouTube (share link): Link to chapter related to project in Demo Day video
  • Imgur (Link to image png, jpg, gif): Use something like ImgBB to upload a screenshot of the site or app and add the URL
  1. Click Submit
  2. Repeat
  3. Share

Fill out the form



Choice Title: Name of project

Link: Link to site or app
YouTube (share link): Link to chapter related to project in Demo Day video
Imgur (Link to image png, jpg, gif): Use something like ImgBB to upload a screenshot of the site or app and add the URL

44.title: Add Choices

45.html:
Retro Signal Sessions reward contributors for work completed in a season that supports the DAOs priorities from the Objective Signal Session.

The Retro Signal Session is a two week event that happens at the end of each quarter.

The proposal to Create a Signal TCR should be submitted 14 days before the end of the month. The end date of the proposal should be set for the last day of the month. It is helpful to add an event on the calendar to provide a reminder to start this process.

  • Voting Period: 4 days
  • Grace Period: 3 days
  • Retro Signal Session: 7 days
45.text:
Retro Signal Sessions reward contributors for work completed in a season that supports the DAOs priorities from the Objective Signal Session.
The Retro Signal Session is a two week event that happens at the end of each quarter.
The proposal to Create a Signal TCR should be submitted 14 days before the end of the month. The end date of the proposal should be set for the last day of the month. It is helpful to add an event on the calendar to provide a reminder to start this process.

Voting Period: 4 days
Grace Period: 3 days
Retro Signal Session: 7 days
45.title: Create Retro Signal Session

47.html:
Staking in the DAO should be paused prior to starting the Retro Signal Session.

To verify staking is paused goto Stake HAUS and confirm the following banner is displayed:

You can also verify staking is paused in the targetDAO.tsx file on GitHub.
47.text:
Staking in the DAO should be paused prior to starting the Retro Signal Session.
To verify staking is paused goto Stake HAUS and confirm the following banner is displayed:

You can also verify staking is paused in the targetDAO.tsx file on GitHub.
47.title: Verify Staking is Paused

48.html:
If staking is not currently paused you need to take the following steps to pause staking prior to starting the Retro Signal Session:

  1. Goto targetDAO.tsx on GitHub.
  2. Click pencil icon to "Edit this file"
  3. Change:
STAKE_PAUSED: false,

to:

STAKE_PAUSED: true,
48.text:
If staking is not currently paused you need to take the following steps to pause staking prior to starting the Retro Signal Session:

Goto targetDAO.tsx on GitHub.
Click pencil icon to "Edit this file"
Change:

STAKE_PAUSED: false,
to:
STAKE_PAUSED: true,
48.title: Pause Staking

49.html:
1. Use dEth Tools to get the date on the first of next month when staking should resume.

  1. Copy the Unix epoch (in miliseconds):
  2. Edit the Unix epoch
    • Since the epoch is in miliseconds you will need to remove 3 zeros from the end
    • Change: 1088640000000
    • To: 1088640000
  3. Paste your updated Unix epoch in dEth Tools to verify it is correct:

  1. Go back to the targetDAO.tsx file you are editing on GitHub.
  2. Change:
STAKE_NEXT_START: 1711976936; // last end 1704222000, //

to:

STAKE_NEXT_START: 1088640000; // last end 1711976936, //

(notice you take the previous Epoch time and replace last end comment and paste the new time as STAKE_NEXT_START)

  1. Click commit changes
  2. Add Extended description: "Pause staking and update date for resuming"
  3. Select "Create a new branch for this commit and start a pull request"
  4. Name branch: earth2travis-retro5 (your GitHub username dash current retro number)

  1. Open a pull request
  2. Create pull request
  3. Merge pull request
  4. Delete branch

* Need to verify how these changes are deployed and if there are additional steps required

Once the changes have been deployed verify the staking is paused banner appears on Stake Haus

<INSERT SCREENSHOT>

51.title: Create Forum Post on Discord

52.html:
1. Goto PublicHAUS (HQ) Signals
  2. Click Create Signal (at bottom of view)
  • Signal Title: Public HAUS Retro #5 (update retro number to current season)
  • Signal Description: Signal your appreciation to the builders that keep the HAUS standing. Projectooooors, Bizdevooooooors, Maintainooooors, Operatoooooors, Proposalooooooors, and Champions
  • End Date: Last day of month at 11:30 PM
  • Link: Link to Discord Forum post created above
  • Tags: retro, season 5 (update season number to current season)
  1. Click Submit
  2. Vote on Proposal
52.text:
Goto PublicHAUS (HQ) Signals
Click Create Signal (at bottom of view)


Signal Title: Public HAUS Retro #5
(update retro number to current season)
Signal Description: Signal your appreciation to the builders that keep the HAUS standing. Projectooooors, Bizdevooooooors, Maintainooooors, Operatoooooors, Proposalooooooors, and Champions
End Date: Last day of month at 11:30 PM
Link: Link to Discord Forum post created above
Tags: retro, season 5
(update season number to current season)


Click Submit
Vote on Proposal
52.title: Create Signal

53.html:
After the Retro Rewards Signal Session ends it is time to calculate the results and distribute the rewards.

Each team that contributed will have an equal amount of their share distributed amongst team members. The execution of the contract below adds $HAUS to the treasury and distributes nvPUB to contributors from the Season providing increased stake in the PublicHaus DAO.

It is important that these funds are distributed prior to executing the TCR related the next season's objectives so voting weights reflect the rewards.
53.text:
After the Retro Rewards Signal Session ends it is time to calculate the results and distribute the rewards.
Each team that contributed will have an equal amount of their share distributed amongst team members. The execution of the contract below adds $HAUS to the treasury and distributes nvPUB to contributors from the Season providing increased stake in the PublicHaus DAO.
It is important that these funds are distributed prior to executing the TCR related the next season's objectives so voting weights reflect the rewards.
53.title: Distribute Retro Rewards

54.html:
Open the DAOhaus Retro Rewards 2024 Google Sheet. If you do not have access please request it from Ξ2T.

Duplicate the Season # and Season # Splits tabs and rename them according to the current season.

You will need to populate the data in the spreadsheet from the corresponding TCR. For Example, Public HAUS Retro #5 Take 2

  1. Copy the name of Projects into Column A

  1. For each project, copy the Total Staked number in white and paste it into the spreadsheet.
  2. For each project, copy the Quadratic Votes number in red and paste it into the spreadsheet.
  3. Calculate the totals for both Total Staked and Quadratic Votes

  1. For the Total nvPUB paste the total from the DAO Tokens section of the DAO Settings page.
  2. Participation % is calculated by dividing Total Staked by Total nvPUB.
  3. Distribution is calculated by multiplying Participation % by 4000 (amount of $HAUS rewarded for the season).
  4. Calculate Quadratic % by dividing each project's Quadratic Votes by the Total Quadratic Votes and multiplying by 100.

Make sure to use the $ signs in the denominator to lock that cell into the formula.

For Example: =(C2/$C$7)*100

  1. Add the Description of each project from the Retro Rewards TCR.
  2. Calculate Total Rewards for each project by multiplying the Distribution times the Quadratic % divided by 100.

Make sure to use the $ signs to lock that cell into the formuala.

For Example: =($B$10*(D2/100))
54.text:
Open the DAOhaus Retro Rewards 2024 Google Sheet. If you do not have access please request it from Ξ2T.
Duplicate the Season # and Season # Splits tabs and rename them according to the current season.
You will need to populate the data in the spreadsheet from the corresponding TCR. For Example, Public HAUS Retro #5 Take 2

Copy the name of Projects into Column A



For each project, copy the Total Staked number in white and paste it into the spreadsheet.
For each project, copy the Quadratic Votes number in red and paste it into the spreadsheet.
Calculate the totals for both Total Staked and Quadratic Votes



For the Total nvPUB paste the total from the DAO Tokens section of the DAO Settings page.
Participation % is calculated by dividing Total Staked by Total nvPUB.
Distribution is calculated by multiplying Participation % by 4000 (amount of $HAUS rewarded for the season).
Calculate Quadratic % by dividing each project's Quadratic Votes by the Total Quadratic Votes and multiplying by 100.

Make sure to use the $ signs in the denominator to lock that cell into the formula.
For Example: =(C2/$C$7)*100

Add the Description of each project from the Retro Rewards TCR.
Calculate Total Rewards for each project by multiplying the Distribution times the Quadratic % divided by 100.

Make sure to use the $ signs to lock that cell into the formuala.
For Example: =($B$10*(D2/100))
54.title: Calculate Results

55.html:
Copy the Projects and Total Rewards into the Splits tab associated with the current season.

Make sure the formulas refer to tab you have been updating.

For Example: =('Season 5'!$B$10*('Season 5'!D2/100))

Verify the data is the same.
55.text:
Copy the Projects and Total Rewards into the Splits tab associated with the current season.
Make sure the formulas refer to tab you have been updating.
For Example: =('Season 5'!$B$10*('Season 5'!D2/100))
Verify the data is the same.
55.title: Season Splits

56.html:
Next you need to add the wallet address of each project participant. These will be the addresses on Optimism that nvPUB rewards are sent to.

Below each project add a row for each project team member. Add their name and wallet address from the PublicHaus Members page.
56.text:
Next you need to add the wallet address of each project participant. These will be the addresses on Optimism that nvPUB rewards are sent to.
Below each project add a row for each project team member. Add their name and wallet address from the PublicHaus Members page.
56.title: Add Accounts

57.html:
In the "Shipped in Season #" Discord thread associated with the season and on Twitter post messages similar to this:

The results from Public HAUS Retro 5 Take 2 are in! https://signal.daohaus.fun/

There was a total of 200,907.94 nvPUB staked in this retro reward round for a participation rate of 30%

There will be 1196.654681 nvPUB distributed between the following projects:

| Projects         | Rewards     |
| ---------------- | ----------- |
| Speedball        | 355.5938245 |
| YEET From Frames | 309.359768  |
| Cookie Jar       | 194.1301766 |
| NFT Raider       | 169.505995  |
| DIN              | 168.0649171 |

Use Chat GPT to create the Markdown tables from the Google Sheet.

57.title: Share Results

For each project post the Team and Address Markdown table in the "Shipped in Season #" thread similar to the table below.

Please reply to the messages below to confirm the wallet addresses of the project team members:

| Name     | Address                                    |
| -------- | ------------------------------------------ |
| Dekan    | 0xbaf6e57a3940898fd21076b139d4ab231dcbbc5f |
| Sam      | 0x83ab8e31df35aa3281d630529c6f4bf5ac7f7abf |

@ mention to confirm the know addresses are correct and to get the wallet of those missing.

Hopefully we can have all the blanks filled out before the next Community Camp https://discord.gg/vdb9Hd8w?event=1263587854991491165`

58.title: Gather Missing Accounts

59.html:
Fill out the Rewards column by dividing the Total Rewards for each project by the number of team members.

Make sure to use the $ signs to lock that cell into the formula.

For Example: =$B$2/5
59.text:
Fill out the Rewards column by dividing the Total Rewards for each project by the number of team members.
Make sure to use the $ signs to lock that cell into the formula.
For Example: =$B$2/5
59.title: Calculate Rewards

60.html:
Some team members will have contributed to multiple projects. Copy and paste the Team Column and ask Chat GPT to "Count how many instances of each name there are:"

That table can be copied and pasted into the bottom of the Splits tab.

For members who have contributed to multiple teams add additional rows under their name.

Fill out the Project Name for all contributors. Add their Address once and link to the Rewards for each project.

Make sure the total for this Rewards column matches the Total Rewards above.

For contributors on multiple projects create a formula to add their Total rewards.

For Example: =sum(E23:E25)

For contributors to one project just refer to the cell next to it.

Make sure the total for this Total column matches the Rewards column.
60.text:
Some team members will have contributed to multiple projects. Copy and paste the Team Column and ask Chat GPT to "Count how many instances of each name there are:"
That table can be copied and pasted into the bottom of the Splits tab.
For members who have contributed to multiple teams add additional rows under their name.
Fill out the Project Name for all contributors. Add their Address once and link to the Rewards for each project.
Make sure the total for this Rewards column matches the Total Rewards above.
For contributors on multiple projects create a formula to add their Total rewards.
For Example: =sum(E23:E25)
For contributors to one project just refer to the cell next to it.
Make sure the total for this Total column matches the Rewards column.
60.title: Add Rewards

61.html:
Make a copy of the the rewards table you just filled out and paste it at the bottom of the sheet.

Remove the Projects and Count information. Remove any empty rows below a members name. Remove the Rewards heading and data.

In the Totals column link each cell to the total for that member from the Totals above. For members who only contributed to one project link that cell to the Rewards from above.
61.text:
Make a copy of the the rewards table you just filled out and paste it at the bottom of the sheet.
Remove the Projects and Count information. Remove any empty rows below a members name. Remove the Rewards heading and data.
In the Totals column link each cell to the total for that member from the Totals above. For members who only contributed to one project link that cell to the Rewards from above.
61.title: Sum Rewards

62.html: Next the Totals need to be converted into WEI. dEth Tools Eth Unit Conversion is a good way to do this manually but the formula is: =F46*1000000000000000000 (1 with 18 zeros)
62.text: Next the Totals need to be converted into WEI. dEth Tools Eth Unit Conversion is a good way to do this manually but the formula is: =F46*1000000000000000000 (1 with 18 zeros)
62.title: Convert to WEI

63.html:
The problem with using the formula is the commas have to be removed between the digits. You can do that with the Chat-GPT prompt below.

Copy and paste the Address data into Chat-GPT with the following prompt:

Create a JavaScript array with these addresses:
 
{addresses}
 
The array should only be the brackets. It does not need a name or equals sign. It is also not necessary to include the semicolon.

Paste the results into the spreadsheet under \_accounts (address[])

Copy and paste the WEI data into Chat-GPT with the following prompt:

Create a JavaScript array with these amounts:
 
{amounts}
 
The array should only be the brackets. It does not need a name or equals sign. Please remove the commas between the digits. It is also not necessary to include the semicolon.

Paste the results into the spreadsheet under _claims (uint256[])
63.text:
The problem with using the formula is the commas have to be removed between the digits. You can do that with the Chat-GPT prompt below.
Copy and paste the Address data into Chat-GPT with the following prompt:
Create a JavaScript array with these addresses:
 
{addresses}
 
The array should only be the brackets. It does not need a name or equals sign. It is also not necessary to include the semicolon.
Paste the results into the spreadsheet under \_accounts (address[])
Copy and paste the WEI data into Chat-GPT with the following prompt:
Create a JavaScript array with these amounts:
 
{amounts}
 
The array should only be the brackets. It does not need a name or equals sign. Please remove the commas between the digits. It is also not necessary to include the semicolon.
Paste the results into the spreadsheet under _claims (uint256[])
63.title: Create Arrays

64.html: Now that the spreadsheet is complete please send it to another DAO member to verify it is correct. Ask them to review the data and approve it.
64.text: Now that the spreadsheet is complete please send it to another DAO member to verify it is correct. Ask them to review the data and approve it.
64.title: A Second Look

65.html:
The StakeClaimShaman contract on Optimism is at the following address: 0x22F09C11De8f059840FD8F60b11b8d60DeA0E011

Goto the Contract on Optimistic Etherscan.

Drop down Token Holdings and make sure there is enough $HAUS to cover the Total Rewards.
65.text:
The StakeClaimShaman contract on Optimism is at the following address: 0x22F09C11De8f059840FD8F60b11b8d60DeA0E011
Goto the Contract on Optimistic Etherscan.
Drop down Token Holdings and make sure there is enough $HAUS to cover the Total Rewards.
65.title: Transaction

66.html:
Next we need to create the contract transaction from the Gnosis Safe App.

The transaction will have to be signed by the Elected Reward Committee

Goto the Elected Reward Committee Gnosis Safe on Optimism.

  • Click New Transaction
  • Click Transaction Builder
  • Enter Address: 0x22F09C11De8f059840FD8F60b11b8d60DeA0E011
  • Enter ABI:
[{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"Claim","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"DaoWithdraw","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint8","name":"version","type":"uint8"}],"name":"Initialized","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"previousOwner","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"OwnershipTransferred","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"address[]","name":"accounts","type":"address[]"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"amounts","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"SetClaims","type":"event"},{"inputs":[],"name":"baal","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract IBaal","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_to","type":"address"}],"name":"claim","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_account","type":"address"}],"name":"claimOf","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"claims","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_moloch","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_stakeToken","type":"address"},{"internalType":"bool","name":"_isShares","type":"bool"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_multiplier","type":"uint256"}],"name":"init","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"isShares","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"multiplier","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"name","outputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"","type":"string"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"owner","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"renounceOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"stakeToken","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract IERC20","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address[]","name":"_accounts","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"_claims","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"updateClaims","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}]

You can also copy the Contract ABI from the bottom of the Contract Code on the Optimism block explorer.

Click the drop-down for the Contract Method Selector and choose updateClaims

Paste the arrays you added to the spreadsheet in the previous section and make sure there are no errors.

  • Click Add transaction
  • Click Create Batch
  • Sign transaction

Post a link to the transaction in the Gnosis Safe to the Shipped in Season # Discord thread and at mention the other signers requesting their signature.

Add a checkbox emoji to the post for signers to add to show they have added their signatures.

After the signers have signed and the transaction and has been executed post a link to the transaction on the Optimism blockexplorer in the Shipped in Season # Discord thread

Click New Transaction
Click Transaction Builder

Enter ABI:

Click Add transaction

Sign transaction

66.title: Create Batch

67.html:
Next you need to post a link to Claims in the Shipped in Season # Discord thread.

Retro Rewards have been distributed fro Season #: https://optimistic.etherscan.io

Go to the Claims page to get your nvPUB. https://join.daohaus.fun/#/claim

@PublicHaus Season # Retro Rewards have been distributed:

https://optimistic.etherscan.io/

We had some kick ass projects last season:

| Projects  | Rewards     |
| --------- | ----------- |

| Project 2 | 000.0000000 |
| Project 3 | 000.0000000 |

67.title: Notify Community

68.html:
To add the event to Signals the Create a Signal TCR proposal associated with the seasons retro rewards needs to be executed.

  1. Goto Proposals
  2. View Details of the proposal
  3. Click Execute
  4. Add Choices
68.text:
To add the event to Signals the Create a Signal TCR proposal associated with the seasons retro rewards needs to be executed.

Goto Proposals
View Details of the proposal
Click Execute
Add Choices
68.title: Execute Retro Rewards Proposal

69.html:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the choices from Demo Day have been added the community needs to be notified.

  • Click the session on Signals
  • Verify the choices have been added
  • Click the session and copy URL
69.text:
Once the proposal for the Retro Signal Session has been executed and the choices from Demo Day have been added the community needs to be notified.

Click the session on Signals
Verify the choices have been added
Click the session and copy URL
69.title: Share Retro Signal Session

70.html:
• Post link in 🍻-tavern channel on Discord
  • Post link in forum discussion for Season # Objectives
  • Post link on Twitter
  • Post from other social accounts
  • Post link to tweet in 💥-news-flash channel on Discord
  • Encourage the community to vote, add choices, and share

Post link in 🍻-tavern channel on Discord
Post link in forum discussion for Season # Objectives
Post link on Twitter
Post from other social accounts
Post link to tweet in 💥-news-flash channel on Discord
Encourage the community to vote, add choices, and share
70.title: Shill

71.html: The day before the Retro Signal Session ends repeat steps in Shill
71.text: The day before the Retro Signal Session ends repeat steps in Shill
71.title: Remind

72.html: After the signal session ends post the results in Discord and Twitter.
72.text: After the signal session ends post the results in Discord and Twitter.
72.title: Share Results

73.html:
Next we need to ensure there is adequate $HAUS for the retro rewards. Currently 4000 $HAUS (~3% of total uncirculating supply) is converted in order to distribute nvPUB to contributors for each season.

We need to transfer that $HAUS from the Gnosis Safe on Optimism into the StakeClaimShaman contract.

The Elected Reward Committee is managed under Roles with Hats Protocol:
73.text:
Next we need to ensure there is adequate $HAUS for the retro rewards. Currently 4000 $HAUS (~3% of total uncirculating supply) is converted in order to distribute nvPUB to contributors for each season.
We need to transfer that $HAUS from the Gnosis Safe on Optimism into the StakeClaimShaman contract.
The Elected Reward Committee is managed under Roles with Hats Protocol:
73.title: Transfer Retro Rewards

74.html: Check the $HAUS balance of the `StakeClaimShaman' contract on the Optimism block explorer by clicking the drop-down below the Token Holdings label.
74.text: Check the $HAUS balance of the `StakeClaimShaman' contract on the Optimism block explorer by clicking the drop-down below the Token Holdings label.
74.title: Check Balance

75.html:
Create proposal to transfer 4000 HAUS (~3% of total uncirculating supply) to the Rewards Committee Safe.

These tokens will be transfered to the StakeClaimShaman contract by the Rewards COmmittee after the Retro Results.

Example Proposal: Transfer Season 5 Retro Rewards for Distribution

  1. Goto Safes Page
  2. Click the ... menu for the ECO Fund safe
  3. Select Transfer ERC-20
  • Title: Transfer Season # Retro Rewards for Distribution
  • Description: Transfer 4000 $HAUS (~3% of total uncirculating supply) to Elected Reward Committee to distribute for Season #.
  • Link: https://app.hatsprotocol.xyz/trees/10/24?compact=true&hatId=24.3.2
  • Safe Name: Eco Fund
  • Recipient: 0x02Cd00B0Aec913c30577e4FCE3179aEd91D6C315
  • Requested ERC20: 4000 HAUS
  1. Click Submit
  2. Vote Yes on Proposal

Post in 🏛-publichaus-chat

Proposal to transfer 4000 $HAUS (~3% of total uncirculating supply) to Elected Reward Committee to distribute for Season #: https://admin.daohaus.club/#/molochV3/0xa/0xf5d6b637a9185707f52d40d452956ca49018247a/proposals

  1. Execute proposal after the Grace Period

76.html:
Once the proposal for the Objectives Signal Session has been executed we can add the choices for seasonal objectives.

Additional choices can be added by the community but adding the projects from the Seasonal Objectives discussion provides options.
76.text:
Once the proposal for the Objectives Signal Session has been executed we can add the choices for seasonal objectives.
Additional choices can be added by the community but adding the projects from the Seasonal Objectives discussion provides options.
76.title: Add Seasonal Objectives Choices

78.html:
Copy and paste the Markdown from the Seasonal Objectives discussion into Chat-GPT under the following prompt:

How could we summarize this list into 5 primary objectives?
What are the best ways to write these objectives according the OKR format from Measure What Matters?
Okay if these are the primary objectives:
 
- Objective 1
- Objective 2
- Objective 3
- Objective 4
- Objective 5
 
How can we rewrite the key results to include information from our notes?
Instead of writing the key results for each objective lets phrase those as paragraphs describing the possibilities of what people could work on.
78.text:
Copy and paste the Markdown from the Seasonal Objectives discussion into Chat-GPT under the following prompt:
How could we summarize this list into 5 primary objectives?
What are the best ways to write these objectives according the OKR format from Measure What Matters?
Okay if these are the primary objectives:
 
- Objective 1
- Objective 2
- Objective 3
- Objective 4
- Objective 5
 
How can we rewrite the key results to include information from our notes?
Instead of writing the key results for each objective lets phrase those as paragraphs describing the possibilities of what people could work on.
78.title: Titles and Descriptions

79.html:
Next you will need to generate an image for each objective. You can choose whatever keywords you want to style the prompts but each should include the objectives from above.

Example Midjourney Prompt:

\imagine propaganda poster, in style of Shepard Fairey, poster is for promoting Objective 1, punk, dark blue --ar 16:9
79.text:
Next you will need to generate an image for each objective. You can choose whatever keywords you want to style the prompts but each should include the objectives from above.
Example Midjourney Prompt:
\imagine propaganda poster, in style of Shepard Fairey, poster is for promoting Objective 1, punk, dark blue --ar 16:9
79.title: Images

80.html:
• Goto Signals
  • Click the session

For each objective:

  1. Click Add Choice
  2. Fill out the form

  • Choice Title: Name of objective
  • Choice Description (markdown): Brief description of objective
  • Link:
  • YouTube (share link):
  • Imgur (Link to image png, jpg, gif): Use something like ImgBB to upload the generated images and add the URL
  1. Click Submit
  2. Repeat
  3. Share
80.text:
Goto Signals
Click the session

For each objective:

Click Add Choice
Fill out the form



Choice Title: Name of objective
Choice Description (markdown): Brief description of objective
Link:
YouTube (share link):
Imgur (Link to image png, jpg, gif): Use something like ImgBB to upload the generated images and add the URL


Click Submit
Repeat
Share
80.title: Add Choices

81.html:
Objectives Signal Sessions decide what the DAO should prioritize in the next season. The results from Objectives influence how contributors are rewarded in the Retro.

The Objectives Session is a two week event that happens at the beginning of each quarter.

The proposal to Create a Signal TCR should be submitted 7 days before the end of the month. The end date of the proposal should be set for the first Friday of the month.

  • Voting Period: 4 days
  • Grace Period: 3 days
  • Retro Signal Sessions: 7 days
81.text:
Objectives Signal Sessions decide what the DAO should prioritize in the next season. The results from Objectives influence how contributors are rewarded in the Retro.
The Objectives Session is a two week event that happens at the beginning of each quarter.
The proposal to Create a Signal TCR should be submitted 7 days before the end of the month. The end date of the proposal should be set for the first Friday of the month.

Voting Period: 4 days
Grace Period: 3 days
Retro Signal Sessions: 7 days
81.title: Create Objectives Signal Session

82.html:
1. Goto 📜-public-forum channel on Discord.
  2. Click New Post

Title: Season # Objectives

Message: Let's discuss our objectives for next season. This is an opportunity for everyone to collaboratively define our goals. What do you want for us to work on and why?

Tags: Objectives

Once the post has been created copy the link to it to use in the proposal below.
82.text:
Goto 📜-public-forum channel on Discord.
Click New Post

Title: Season # Objectives
Message: Let's discuss our objectives for next season. This is an opportunity for everyone to collaboratively define our goals. What do you want for us to work on and why?
Tags: Objectives
Once the post has been created copy the link to it to use in the proposal below.
82.title: Create Forum Post on Discord

83.html:
These steps can be completed once the Retro Rewards session starts.

Verify STAKE_PAUSED: false in targetDAO.tsx

If STAKE_PAUSED: true set a reminder to Resume Staking before the proposal below is executed.
83.text:
These steps can be completed once the Retro Rewards session starts.
Verify STAKE_PAUSED: false in targetDAO.tsx
If STAKE_PAUSED: true set a reminder to Resume Staking before the proposal below is executed.
83.title: Verify Staking is Unpaused

84.html:
Open staking should be started before execution of this proposal.

  1. Goto PublicHAUS (HQ) Signals
  2. Click Create Signal (at bottom of view)
  • Signal Title: PublicHaus Season # Objectives (update retro number to current season)
  • Signal Description:

What are the most important things we should be working on?

Help us establish our Objectives for next season. This exercise is an opportunity for everyone to collaboratively define our goals. When you Add Choice try to include a verb in the title. Make the description informative but not prescriptive. Individual projects can decide how the results of their efforts support the objectives.

  • End Date: First Friday of month at 11:30 PM
  • Link: Link to Discord Forum post created above
  • Tags: objectives, season # (update season number to current season)
  1. Click Submit
  2. Vote on Proposal
84.text:
Open staking should be started before execution of this proposal.

Goto PublicHAUS (HQ) Signals
Click Create Signal (at bottom of view)


Signal Title: PublicHaus Season # Objectives
(update retro number to current season)
Signal Description:

What are the most important things we should be working on?
Help us establish our Objectives for next season. This exercise is an opportunity for everyone to collaboratively define our goals. When you Add Choice try to include a verb in the title. Make the description informative but not prescriptive. Individual projects can decide how the results of their efforts support the objectives.

End Date: First Friday of month at 11:30 PM
Link: Link to Discord Forum post created above
Tags: objectives, season #
(update season number to current season)


Click Submit
Vote on Proposal
84.title: Create Signal Proposal

85.html:
The Community Camp following Demo Day should be dedicated to aligning on what contributors want to work on in the coming season. This is subjective and can be based on what the Haus needs most or what individuals are interested in exploring.

Ideally the discussion can be timeboxed into a workshop format. Make sure someone is assigned to taking notes during the discussion. You can use a whiteboard in Discord or Miro for the community to input ideas.

Document the agreed-upon high-level objectives in a Markdown document on HackMD. Summarize key decisions, actions, and objectives.

Share the document with the community in the Season # Objectives forum post on Discord.
85.text:
The Community Camp following Demo Day should be dedicated to aligning on what contributors want to work on in the coming season. This is subjective and can be based on what the Haus needs most or what individuals are interested in exploring.
Ideally the discussion can be timeboxed into a workshop format. Make sure someone is assigned to taking notes during the discussion. You can use a whiteboard in Discord or Miro for the community to input ideas.
Document the agreed-upon high-level objectives in a Markdown document on HackMD. Summarize key decisions, actions, and objectives.
Share the document with the community in the Season # Objectives forum post on Discord.
85.title: Discuss Seasonal Objectives

86.html:
Make sure to Distribute Retro Rewards for the previous season before executing this proposal. Contributors should have an opportunity to claim and stake their rewards. When this proposal is executed a snapshot of members current stake is taken to capture voting weight.

To add the event to Signals the Create a Signal TCR proposal associated with the seasons retro rewards needs to be executed.

  1. Goto Proposals
  2. View Details of the proposal
  3. Click Execute
  4. Add Choices
86.text:
Make sure to Distribute Retro Rewards for the previous season before executing this proposal. Contributors should have an opportunity to claim and stake their rewards. When this proposal is executed a snapshot of members current stake is taken to capture voting weight.
To add the event to Signals the Create a Signal TCR proposal associated with the seasons retro rewards needs to be executed.

Goto Proposals
View Details of the proposal
Click Execute
Add Choices
86.title: Execute Seasonal Objectives Proposal

87.html:
Once the choices from Demo Day have been added the community needs to be notified.

  • Click the session on Signals
  • Verify the choices have been added
  • Click the session and copy URL
